sentences.english: but at least it got the juices flowing.
The white juice oozes out the sides.
sentences.chinese: 白色的汁液从边上渗出来。

sentences.english: Natural rubber has been gathered from the sap of plants for centuries.
sentences.chinese: 从植物汁液中收集天然橡胶已经有几个世纪的历史。

sentences.english: Making bamboo beer requires a process of fermenting the rich natural sugars of the plant’s sap.
sentences.chinese: 酿竹子酒需要将竹子汁液中富含的天然糖分发酵。

sentences.english: Bees produce a compound called propolis from the sap on needle-leaved trees or evergreens.
sentences.chinese: 蜜蜂利用针叶树或常绿植物的汁液制造蜂胶化合物。

sentences.english: This is what happens to what I love, the life-juice sucked out;
sentences.chinese: 生命的汁液被吸得一干二净，这就是我所爱者的遭遇。

sentences.english: The sap of this plant blisters the skin.
sentences.chinese: 这种植物的汁液会使皮肤起水疱。

sentences.english: Milled groove; collects meat and fruit juices while cutting.
sentences.chinese: 压花凹槽，切割肉和水果时可汇集汁液。

sentences.english: They suck juices out of the plant.
sentences.chinese: 他们从植物里吸取汁液。

sentences.english: The fruit become the size of a orange, and have a thick yellow peel which oozes a yellow latex when pressed.
sentences.chinese: 果实大小如同橘子，皮厚，挤压有黄色汁液流出。

sentences.english: We took the ripe pomegranates from the trees, and brake them and drank their sweet juices.
sentences.chinese: 我们从树上摘下成熟的石榴，砸开，喝下甜甜的汁液。

sentences.english: They crush the juice out of the fruit by treading it.
sentences.chinese: 他们用脚把水果踩出汁液来。

sentences.english: As for the juice thicker the "Neep Neep" toothbrush would help to alleviate the toothache.
sentences.chinese: 至于汁液更浓的“尼普尼普”牙刷则有助于缓解牙痛。

sentences.english: But there’s obviously a compound in tomatoes that alcohol dissolves and pulls out into the sauce.
sentences.chinese: 但是明显番茄中的化合物溶解于酒精后进入了汁液中。

sentences.english: Sunlight won 't betray my lemon juice.
sentences.chinese: 阳光也不会褪去我的柠檬色的汁液。

sentences.english: In this paper, the transport characteristics of the nitrogenous com-pounds in the xylem sap of soybean plant were studied.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究了大豆植株木质部汁液中氮素运输特征。

definition: to mash/to beat to a pulp
